review_title: Fair Ways is an  Exceptional organisation.
job_title: Director of IT Communications in London, England
pros:
Totally focused on developing our staff to deliver consistently outstanding care through education, training & support. 
In 2021 Fair Ways converted to full charity status. This means that all surplus funds are reinvested into improving services. There are no external shareholders, no dividends, no clever financial structuring that sees funding provided by the state being used for corporate gain.
cons: Currently only based in the Solent area. Over time the charity will expand to make these fantastic services available to a wider network.

review_title: Great place to work if its your passion
job_title: Senior Support Worker/Residential Home in Bournemouth, England
pros:
Training opportunities are incredible
Monthly supervision to support you in your growth
Attempt to get each home as involved with each other as possible
Provide great opportunities
2-on-4-off work week
cons:
17 hour days with no breaks, which can be exhausting
Behaviours exhibited from some of the young people are not suitable for all
They require you to complete a level 3 in residential care if you do not already have one, and will expect you to pay for it if you leave before 6 months after completing the course

pros:
Good team
Care company that actually cares about the people they care for and staff.
Well paid
cons: Challenging behaviour has a shelf life!
